alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 23 at 3:16AM MDT until October 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the High Wind Warning, beginning at 6 AM, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 6 AM MDT early this morning. For the High Wind Warning, from 6 AM MDT until 7 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large trees that were severely burned during the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon fire will be especially susceptible to being blown down. Areas of reduced visibility in blowing snow will also be possible later today.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
